intro: Xeraea pungens, commonly known as the spiny nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and small, violet-colored flowers. Its fruit is a berry that turns from green to yellow as it matures. Xeraea pungens is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
